replies.body: Without getting into whether this particular argument is the issue with marksmen (I certainly think it's fair to say there could be several), it's pretty likely marksmen issues get some attention in the near future, especially if we're going to be looking to diversify the kinds of champions that can be played in the bottom lane effectively. Item efficiency could be one of the things to look at.
Do you have any regrets from the update, since you were one of the big reworkers of the update
Kinda... There are definitely things I would do differently a second time around, but hindsight is 20/20, so yeah.

> [{quoted}](name=RiotRepertoir,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=NkdAMgNZ,comment-id=001500030000,timestamp=2018-02-26T01:52:55.243+0000)

May I ask if you personally regret making Rageblade an Item only for Ranged Champions/ADCs? I loved playing the old Rageblade on Melees and was pretty disappointed after the Rework.
On a personal level, no. I had very little involvement in that particular decision.

Not necessarily asking what items you were particularly involved in, but are you saying that there are independent, at least to a certain extent, teams or individuals working on different item updates? Just seems rather unintuitive given that, aside from the testing of them, those projects seem like much more of a conceptual task than a labor intensive one that'd benefit from dividing the work up separately.
There can be. I may be off, but didn't Rageblade get changed sometime after the marksman update?

Well it had 2. There was the splash one that was in the marksman update. The current one was alongside the devourer removal. I and many other players that played mostly melee champs that could take good advantage of that (a few that got preemptive AP ratio buffs) are still very sour that the item was pretty effectively gutted for the melee users while kog, kayle, teemo, varus, and the rare vayne could be happy with it.

Especially more so after wit's end got a recent change that has been similarly requested of rageblade.

Is it really going to take the same number of years of it being too unfairly favored by marksman like wits end was, or are you guys going to cop out and treat it like zephyr with (too niche, not enough users).

5.22 saw the hydra variant of Rageblade it was later replaced with the phantom hit Rageblade in 6.9 for being too snowbally at its 2800 gold price point, speaking of which has anything changed on that front Rageblade seems to be just as snowbally now as it was back then? Kog and Varus winrates in the first 25 minutes of the game were consistently 50%+ until Kog was nerfed in 8.3. 

Is Rageblade a problem item the balance team has on their radar or are Kog and Varus just pushing the limits of what the item should do?

My biggest problem with ADCs is how fast they can itemnize to outburst everyone else. For a class whose biggest strengths are ramp damage/ dps and objective taking, at the cost of weak early game, the fact that they can burst like assassins with only two items while still having 10 shields placed on them by supports makes the class ridiculously overpowered at the current state.

(And I'm actually fine with supports being stronger than before, really.)
Are there any plans to have marksmen who focus on other stats than crit?  Lethality on marksmen seemed to be a thing for a while, but that's steadily been less effective.

The best work would be comprehensive and touch on all kinds of marksmen. Hopefully time allows for that. I don't know the exact nature of the work being done here, as I'm not directly involved with it at this point.

I really like this turn around where you are actually talking to the community. It probably isn't perfect or even close, but it's the first step and that is enough for today. I hope we never have to go back to the days where getting a response would require a gunshot.

I hope the Aatrox rework keeps his fun dueling playstyle and it just as massacring. I hope that whenever discussion for the Kayle rework happens, you come talk to the Kayle mains, preferably on Discord or something, but hopefully not blown up and the server getting flooded.

Hoping you see this comment before this thread potentially gets blown up. Thank you.

> unless you get lucky with your crits(which is the main issue with adc since the very beginning of time it self),

Fun fact: Crits in LoL are ***not*** random. The are mechanics in place to make sure people don't crit too much or too little

Fun fact: **That still is random.**
The algorythem gets skewed so instead of haveing lets say 30% chance on every hit, you have below 30%  for some hits after a crit and above 30% after not critting for a while.
This means the chance for multiple crits in a row(or a non crit streak) is lower than it would be with a flat 30%, **but the chance still exists and it still does happen!!!**

it's like saying crit with 99% isn't random, yet there are still these nastsy 1% non crits that sometimes actually happen.
People really don't get the concept of randomness...

Intentionally skewing results to end with a predetermined average is NOT random. Are you joking? In the real world you flip a coin and get heads. What is the probability the next flip is heads? 50%. Does it matter that you flipped heads right before that? ***No.*** THAT is random. Crits in league are NOT random. Each outcome intentionally skews the odds towards a specific outcome. Do YOU know what random is?

Skewed odds are still odds, it's like loaded dice, the results are skewed, but for each singel roll you still can't say for sure what you get.
Same with pseudo rng, results are screwed, yet for every single hit, there is no way to tell wether it crits or not, as it's still random.
It doesn't matter if the chance for a crit drops to 0.0001% after your last crit, it still is there and can eventually happen no matter how bad the odds are. People win the lottery after all...

But skewed odds are ***NOT IN ANY WAY*** "random."


They are systemically skewed by other variables and factors.  FFS its literally by definition.  You don't know what the words you are using mean.

Throwback to season 3, when I first started playing. Friends told me marksmen go bottom lane because they were "more reliant on gold than levels", which I think was somewhat true, considering everyone built {{item:3072}} first and then went something like {{item:3087}} {{item:3031}} and the old last whisper after. The build was pretty expensive, but now ADC items are fairly cheap, so...
Old {{item:3072}} with full stacks gave 100AD, that's why adcs build it first.
there was also the possibility of getting ~~one shoted~~ punished for bad placement so they also needed to heal themselves to survive the struggle of early game
And they didn't get more than a lifesteal items worth of sustain passively and free from level 1 onwards.

As an adc main I don't really like the Bloodlust/Fleetwork but they force us to pick it since Fervor was nerfed for adcs and with the new ones PTA was also nerfed. 

So it's Rito who on purpuse wants adc to not have a dmg Keystone/BigRune and we end up picking the sustain one since the dmg are worthles.
